required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Physical Training on Adipose Tissue Metabolism and Insulin Sensitivity in the Menopausal Transition Phase
clinical_study.official_title: A Training Intervention Study in Late Pre- and Early Postmenopausal Women Investigating the Changes in Adipose Tissue Metabolism and Peripheral Insulin Sensitivity

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: The Regional Committee on Biomedical Research Ethics

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if physical exercise reduces the adverse changes in adipose tissue metabolism and insulin sensitivity that occurs in women during the menopausal transition.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.measure: Insulin stimulated uptake of glucose in adipose tissue
primary_outcome.description: Measured by Positron Emission Tomography-Computed tomography (PET/CT)

secondary_outcome.description: Fasting plasma insulin, homeostasis model assessment insulin resistance and measures of central insulin sensitivity derived from an oral glucose tolerance test
Measured using indirect calorimetry and an incremental bicycle protocol
As measured by high density lipoprotein, triglycerides, waist circumference, blood pressure, mean arterial pressure, fasting glucose and composite metabolic syndrome scores
Measured using questionaries, semi-structured interviews and observations
Measured using dual x-ray absorptiometry, height, weight, waist and hip circumference, sagittal abdominal height
Biochemical, proteomics, metabolomics, genomics and morphological analyses
Biochemical, proteomics, metabolomics, genomics and morphological analyses
Will be measured by indirect calorimetry

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical activity level and duration of sleep
secondary_outcome.description: Daily activity and duration of sleep will be recorded during one week using ActibeltÂ® and self reporting
Biochemical, proteomics, metabolomics, genomics and morphological analyses

other_outcome.description: Daily food intake for three week days and one week-end day will be reported by the subjects

arm_group.description: The premenopausal women will be attending Spinning classes.
The postmenopausal women will be attending Spinning classes.

intervention.description: After the baseline studies, the women will perform Spinning three times a week. Two of the sessions are performed on our location by trained instructors and the third training is self-training in a local fitness center where we provide free membership. All trainings are heart rate monitored.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Premenopausal OR Postmenopausal (45-57 years)
- No chronical Diseases
- BMI > 18,5 and < 30
- Sedentary (no regular physical activity the last 2 years)
- Either regular bleeding (premenopausal) OR no menstruation for at least 2 years (postmenopausal)
- Plasma measurements:
Premenopausal: estradiol > 0.20nmol/l, Follicle Stimulating Hormone < 22 IU/l and progesterone > 2.5 nmol/l Postmenopausal: estradiol < 0.20nmol/l, Follicle Stimulating Hormone > 22 IU/l and progesterone from 0.3-2.5 nmol/l
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smoking
- Excessive alcohol intake
- Regular medication including hormone replacement treatment
